intro: Froelichia gracilis, commonly known as the slender froelichia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, linear leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in shaded woodlands. Froelichia gracilis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
